entry.title: Setup new mac notes
entry.content:
Config new system when you switch to another mac(10.8.4)

{% codeblock %}
$ ruby -e "$(curl -fsSL https://raw.github.com/mxcl/homebrew/go)"
$ brew install wget
$ brew install curl
{% endcodeblock %}

Basic terminal setup

{% codeblock ~/.vimrc %} " basic settings set number set hidden set history=10000 set cursorline hi CursorLine cterm=NONE ctermbg=lightblue ctermfg=darkyellow set ruler set cmdheight=2 set hlsearch set tabstop=4 set shiftwidth=4 set softtabstop=4 set autoindent set ignorecase smartcase set showcmd syntax on

{% endcodeblock %}

iTerm2 theme : thayer iterm2 themes {% codeblock ~/.bash_profile %}

system cmd

alias ll="ls -Gl" alias lll="ls -Gla"

terminal

export CLICOLOR=1

\h:\W \u\$

export PS1='[\033[01;33m]\u@\h[\033[01;31m] (\W) \$ [\033[00m]'

grep

alias grep='grep â€“color=always'

export ANDROID_HOME='/Users/LynneQ/Documents/sdks/adt-bundle-mac-x86_64-20130522/sdk' export PATH=${PATH}:${ANDROID_HOME}/platform-tools:${ANDROID_HOME}/tools

alias DocLL='cd /Users/LynneQ/Documents/blog/lynnequ.github.com'

Git

alias gst='git status' alias gba='git branch -a' alias gb='git branch' alias gsts='git status --short' alias gco='git commit -m' alias gad='git add'

[[ -s "$HOME/.rvm/scripts/rvm" ]] && source "$HOME/.rvm/scripts/rvm" # Load RVM into a shell session as a function

{% endcodeblock %}

Notes:

LynneQ:~ lqu$
Definition: machine name, colon, present working directory(~) a sapce, the current user and dollar sign($) (# if the shell has super user)

Install sublime text 2 app

After dmg package installation, to make it usable within terminal.

$ ln -s -F /Applications/Sublime\ Text\ 2.app/Contents/SharedSupport/bin/subl /usr/local/bin/subl

$ subl test.py
$ subl path/to/folder

Re-setup Octopress blog

  1. Copy the git repo to new location
  2. Go set up git credential
  3. To make rake generate/preview/deploy works {% codeblock %}
    $ sudo gem install bundler $ sudo gem update --system $ sudo bundle install

Install rvm and upgrade ruby from 1.8.7 to 1.9.3 $ \curl -L https://get.rvm.io | bash //Install rvm $ source /Users/LynneQ/.rvm/scripts/rvm $ rvm get stable $ rvm requirements $ rvm install 1.9.3 $ rvm list $ ruby -v ruby 1.8.7 (2012-02-08 patchlevel 358) [universal-darwin12.0]

$ rvm use --default 1.9.3 Using /Users/LynneQ/.rvm/gems/ruby-1.9.3-p429

$ ruby -v ruby 1.9.3p429 (2013-05-15 revision 40747) [x86_64-darwin12.4.0]
{% endcodeblock %}

Unfornately, if you bundle install before upgrade to 1.9.3, you need to restart the shell, and do bundle install again.

entry.title: Tricky terminial note
entry.content:
Copy from clipboard into file

  1. Copy the content
  2. Go to the terminal
    {% codeblock %}
    $ pbpaste > test.py
    $ cat test.py
    {% endcodeblock %}

Misc:

{% codeblock %}

$ cat test.txt | pbcopy # copy things to system clipboard $ echo hello | pbcopy # same as above $ pbcopy < test.txt # copy from a file, so you can use cmd + V $ echo pbpaste #you will see the content in the clipboard

{% endcodeblock %}

[pbcopy] takes the standard input and places it in the specified pasteboard.

[pbpaste]removes the data from the pasteboard and writes it to the standard output.

iTerm2 tricks

  1. Autocomplete
    cmd" + ;
  2. Show clipboard history
    command+shift+h
  3. Enter/exit full screen (not for hotkey window)
    cmd + enter
  4. Search under all tab
    cmd + opt + e
  5. Search in the tab
    cmd + f
    cmd + g//next result
  6. Enable meta key Under iTerm 2 preference > profile > keys, set left option key acts as "+Esc"
    alt + b

Terminal shortcuts

cmd + u : delete till the start of line

cmd + k : delete till the end of line

Show files inside jar
jar tf file.jar
